instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V8_SUS: What is PP1V8_SUS? PP1V8_SUS is a 1.8v power rail active in a suspend state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Arrived with liquid damage and severe damage to J9600. Data is important.

Diode mode reading on pin 4 J9600 is 0L and donar board is 0.432. Repaired all other traces on J9600

Is data still saveable if <CHIP>U8600</CHIP> is replaced from donar board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: There is no continuity between <SIGNAL>SSD_BOOT_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SSD_BOOT_LB_L</SIGNAL> lines. Does this need to be fixed at J9600?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Is it possible for this board to boot without J9600?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
You must have continuity between all left/right pins of J9600.
If only one is bad, run wire between corresponding pads into board.

Internal SSD connects to PCH through J9600...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SUS</SIGNAL> is shorted. Removed everything but CPU but short remains.

CPU needs replacing now in order to retrieve data?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Can data still be retrieved even with this shorted CPU through J9600?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Data recovery tool exists, to recover data on this board.
Just need to connect it over J9600.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Which pins on J9600 need to function with continuity to retrieve data with tool? I already have the tool

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: When the data recovery tool is plugged in the data cable gets very hot. All pins have continuity now

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: All pins from the right side (regarding of schematic) connect to the tool.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: No response on tool. All pins have continuity now but pin 4 <SIGNAL>SSD_BOOT_LB_L</SIGNAL> is 0.77 diode and on donar is 427. Is this bad <CHIP>U8600</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: May have chip issue, or bad solder.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Trying to replace <CHIP>U8600</CHIP> pad 315 <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD_HOT</SIGNAL> is missing however all other pads are present after cleanup. Will replacement <CHIP>U8600</CHIP> still work for data recovery with this pad missing?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: The other pads should support 1V8_SSD_HOT power rail.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: To save trouble of replacing <CHIP>U8600</CHIP> would the data be readable or even boot into the OS if <CHIP>U9120</CHIP>/<CHIP>U9200</CHIP>/<CHIP>U9100</CHIP> were moved and soldered to a working <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board since these have the T1 chip?
